Retrocession.definition: the return of title to property to its former or true owner ;specif in the civil law of Louisiana
Retrocession.origin: [French r√©trocession , from Medieval Latin retrocessio retreat, from Late Latin, act of going back, from Latin retrocedere to go back]

1.definition: the return of title to property to its former or true ownerthe return to a decedent's heirs of property of the decedent that had been sold or assigned by coheirs
1.note: An heir's right to retrocession has been repealed.

2.definition: the act of ceding back something (as jurisdiction)

3 a.definition: the process by which all or part of the risks assumed in an insurance contract are reassigned or ceded by a reinsurer to another insurance company
